author: mmathews@times-news.com(Mike Mathews)
title: Sports briefs
text:
Sports briefs Mike Mathews mmathews@times-news.com The Cumberland Times-News Posted on Oct 26, 2015 by Mike Mathews 
Frostburg pair earn conference honors 
PITMAN, N.J. — Frostburg State posted its fifth straight win on the football field Saturday night, a 19-14 win at Christopher Newport, and on Sunday a pair of Bobcats were honored by the New Jersey Athletic Conference. 
Senior defensive back Salaman Riddell was selected as the league’s Defensive Player of the Week and freshman tailback Gavin Lavat was named Offensive Rookie of the Week. 
Riddell posted 10 tackles, including five solo stops with one interception and five pass breakups. He broke up Christopher Newport’s final play of the game, a pass on fourth-and-10 from the Bobcat 16 late in the fourth quarter. He leads the conference in passes defended at 1.71 per contest. 
Lavat, the game’s leading rusher, was named the Offensive Rookie of the Week for the second time after running 21 times for 83 yards and two touchdowns. He also caught a pass for 23 yards and finished the game with 106 total yards in offense. 
Frankfort jayvees place second 
CUMBERLAND — The Frankfort High junior varsity volleyball team went 4-1 in the Fort Hill Invitational on Saturday, finishing runner-up to the host Sentinels. 
The Falcons (17-4) beat Allegany 25-18, 29-27, Jefferson 25-13, 25-14 and Keyser 25-16, 25-12 in pool play, then topped Northern 25-23, 25-14 in the tournament semifinals before falling to Fort Hill by 25-20, 25-23 scores. 
Lauren Whiteman had 29 digs, 28 kills and five service aces for the day. Alli Hockaday had 29 digs, 20 kills and six aces, Kayla Grose 35 digs and 21 kills, Savannah Jenkins 55 assists and five aces, Hannah Dorsey 69 assists and seven aces, Hayley Dorsey 49 digs and 13 aces, Jessica Gollehon 15 kills and two aces, Abbey Spence 10 assists and six aces and Jordan Irving 19 kills. 
Hot Stove League sets meetings 
CUMBERLAND — The Hot Stove League will hold an executive board meeting at 6 p.m., and a managers meeting at 7 p.m., on Tuesday, Oct. 27, at the Hot Stove Bingo Hall. For more information, call 301-759-9066. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
